metadata.Name: OBSINFOX
metadata.Description: A corpus of 100 French news articles from unreliable sources, annotated with 11 labels by 8 annotators to identify fake news characteristics.
metadata.Paper Title: A Multi-Label Dataset of French Fake News: Human and Machine Insights
metadata.Venue Name: Language Resources and Evaluation Conference - International Conference on Computational Linguistics
Affiliations: Université de Rennes, CNRS, Inria, IRISA
metadata.Abstract: We present a corpus of 100 documents, named OBSINFOX, selected from 17 sources of French press considered unreliable by expert agencies, annotated using 11 labels by 8 annotators. By collecting more labels than usual, by more annotators than is typically done, we can identify features that humans consider as characteristic of fake news, and compare them to the predictions of automated classifiers. We present a topic and genre analysis using GATE Cloud, indicative of the prevalence of satire-like text in the corpus. We then use the subjectivity analyzer VAGO, and a neural version of it, to clarify the link between ascriptions of the label Subjective and ascriptions of the label Fake News.
